text.0: eager for spoil my flow of speech i utter may the floods child accept my songs with favour.
text.1: will not the rapid son of waters make them lovely for he it is who shall enjoy them.
text.2: to him let us address the song wellfashioned forth from the heart shall he not understand it.
text.3: the friendly son of waters by the greatness of godhead hath produced all things existing.
text.4: some floods unite themselves and others join them die sounding rivers fill one common storehouse.
text.5: on every side the bright floods have encompassed the bright resplendent offspring of the waters.
text.6: the neversullen waters youthful maidens carefully decking wait on him the youthful.
text.7: he with bright rays shines forth in splendid beauty unfed with wood in waters oilenveloped.
text.8: to him three dames are offering food to feed him goddesses to the god whom none may injure.
text.9: within the waters hath he pressed as hollows and drinks their milk who now are first made mothers.
text.10: here was the horses birth his was the sunlight save thou our princes from the oppressors onslaught.
text.11: him indestructible dwelling at a distance in forts unwrought lies and ill spirits reach not.
text.12: he in whose mansion is the teeming milchcow swells the gods nectar and cats noble viands.
text.13: the son of waters gathering strength in waters shines for his worshipper to give him treasures.
text.14: he who in waters with his own pure godhead shines widely lawabiding everlasting.
text.15: the other worlds are verily his branches and plants are born of him with all their offspring.
text.16: the waters son hath risen and clothed in lightning ascended up unto the curled clouds bosom.
text.17: and bearing with them his supremest glory the youthful ones goldcoloured move around him.
text.18: golden in form is he like gold to look on his colour is like gold the son of waters.
text.19: when he is seated fresh from golden birthplace those who present their gold give food to feed him.
text.20: this the fair name and this the lovely aspect of him the waters son increase in secret.
text.21: whom here the youthful maids together kindle his food is sacred oil of golden colour.
text.22: him nearest friend of many will we worship with sacrifice and reverence and oblation.
text.23: i make his back to shine with chips provide him i offer food and with my songs exalt him.
text.24: the bull hath laid his own lifegerm within them he sucks them as an infant and they kiss him.
text.25: he son of waters of unfading colour hath entered here as in anothers body.
text.26: while here he dwelleth in sublimest station resplendent with the rays that never perish.
text.27: the waters bearing oil to feed their offspring flow youthful ones in wanderings about him.
text.28: agni i gave good shelter to the people and to the princes goodly preparation.
text.29: blessed is all that gods regard with favour loud may we speak with heroes in assembly.
